name: Taj Mahal
short: A symbol of eternal love built by Shah Jahan for Mumtaz Mahal.
description: The Taj Mahal, one of the Seven Wonders of the World, was commissioned by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in 1632 in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal.

name: Qutub Minar
short: A 73-meter-high minaret symbolizing the beginning of Muslim rule in India.
description: Built in 1193 by Qutb-ud-din Aibak and later completed by Iltutmish, Qutub Minar is the tallest brick minaret in the world.

name: Red Fort
short: Historic fort symbolizing India’s freedom and Mughal grandeur.
description: Constructed by Emperor Shah Jahan in 1638, the Red Fort served as the residence of Mughal emperors for over 200 years.

name: Hampi
short: Ancient ruins of the Vijayanagara Empire set amid stunning boulders.
description: Hampi was once the capital of the Vijayanagara Empire and is now a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

name: Mysore Palace
short: A blend of Hindu, Mughal, Rajput, and Gothic styles illuminated by 100,000 bulbs at night.
description: The Mysore Palace, designed by Henry Irwin in 1912, was the residence of the Wadiyar dynasty.

name: Gateway of India
short: An iconic Mumbai landmark overlooking the Arabian Sea.
description: The Gateway of India was built in 1924 to commemorate the visit of King George V and Queen Mary to Mumbai.

name: Charminar
short: Hyderabad’s grand monument and mosque built by Sultan Muhammad Quli Qutb Shah.
description: Constructed in 1591, Charminar is Hyderabad’s most famous landmark and a symbol of its heritage.

name: Sun Temple, Konark
short: A 13th-century chariot-shaped temple dedicated to the Sun God.
description: Built in the 13th century by King Narasimhadeva I, the Konark Sun Temple is designed as a massive chariot.
